results.content: Bueno el curso es como lo dice su titulo "jQuery for Absolute Beginners : From Beginning to Advanced" para principiantes en jQuery, lo que no dice, es que es necesario tener conocimientos previos de programación en javascript. Si bien se menciona un uso avanzado, en mi opinión, esto no llega a ser así ya que el tema da para mucho mas y solo se muestran unas cuantas funciones, faltaría una explicación mas extensa para poder hablar de algo avanzado, y mucho mas teniendo en cuenta que son solo 2.5hs de video, era de suponer que es algo básico. En fin, es un curso perfecto, para iniciarse en jQuery y seguir aprendiendo por cuenta propia.
results.content_html: Bueno el curso es como lo dice su titulo "jQuery for Absolute Beginners : From Beginning to Advanced" para principiantes en jQuery, lo que no dice, es que es necesario tener conocimientos previos de programación en javascript. results.content:
I liked the course and the fact that it is free. I've learned some nice functions jQuery has to offer.
I missed some good practice advice on for instance:
- using a .min version of jquery or using a cdn instead of a local file.
- separating the script  code from the html 
and that sort of stuff.

But again, it's free, what more can we ask for than learning something for free.
results.content_html:
I liked the course and the fact that it is free. I've learned some nice functions jQuery has to offer.
I missed some good practice advice on for instance:
- using a .min version of jquery or using a cdn instead of a local file.
- separating the script code from the html
and that sort of stuff.

But again, it's free, what more can we ask for than learning something for free.

results.content: Great course overall. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to learn jQuery, because the course is progressing at a good pace, not too slow not too fast.

Keeping it aside,the instructor really teaches well.

results.content: Thanks a lot Mr. Keith Hearn and Creative Online School for sparing your valuable time and resources for making this course and sharing it with us for free.  Even though i am an ESL person, i could easily understand Mr. Hearn's English and teaching and could successfully code along and see the results on my PC  --  especially the toggle "swing" and other animations were cool.  I wholeheartedly recommend future students checking out this course to go ahead and enroll.  Really grateful for having had this opportunity.  I wish Creative Online School and Mr. Hearn all the very best in all their future endeavors.
results.content_html: Thanks a lot Mr. Keith Hearn and Creative Online School for sparing your valuable time and resources for making this course and sharing it with us for free. Even though i am an ESL person, i could easily understand Mr. Hearn's English and teaching and could successfully code along and see the results on my PC -- especially the toggle "swing" and other animations were cool. I wholeheartedly recommend future students checking out this course to go ahead and enroll. Really grateful for having had this opportunity. I wish Creative Online School and Mr. Hearn all the very best in all their future endeavors.

results.content: Yes, it was quite interesting. It would have been much better if there were links to resources for future learning and/or examples from real world website from which to practice.
results.content_html: Yes, it was quite interesting. It would have been much better if there were links to resources for future learning and/or examples from real world website from which to practice.

results.content: After completing the course with very good HTML/CSS knowledge and some Javascript experience I don't feel much like an expert. The instructor makes too many errors (course content clearly not as well planned/thought out as it could be - there are things which prove he has not tested things out prior to clicking 'record' - the lectures seem very rushed). Also does not follow/teach best practices half the time, e.g. sometimes does not use correct indentation. For an absolute beginner it'd be decent but for me, yes I learnt a couple of things but don't feel like it went very advanced as it promises.
results.content_html: After completing the course with very good HTML/CSS knowledge and some Javascript experience I don't feel much like an expert. The instructor makes too many errors (course content clearly not as well planned/thought out as it could be - there are things which prove he has not tested things out prior to clicking 'record' - the lectures seem very rushed). Also does not follow/teach best practices half the time, e.g. sometimes does not use correct indentation. For an absolute beginner it'd be decent but for me, yes I learnt a couple of things but don't feel like it went very advanced as it promises.
